text: [researching stem casters for walnut tables] McMaster-Carr only has 1 good option for a caster that comes in a thread size we already have a tap for, and that's this one <http://www.mcmaster.com/#2335t22/=w1gr04> . Nonmarking gray rubber wheels, 5" diameter, 1.25" wide, soft tread. Nylon frame. 240lb capacity each. Available with or without total lock, and in short or long stem sizes.

attachments.title: McMaster-Carr
attachments.text: McMaster-Carr supplies products used to maintain manufacturing plants and large commercial facilities worldwide.

text: I just want to make sure they are super durable as I feel like we will be moving the tables a lot unlike the walnut table in the 350.
If we wanted to buy a new tap, that would open up our options for wheel material (rubber, plastic, polyurethane) and dimensions (1.5625-8" diameter, 1.0625-2.9375" width).
A 1/2"-13 tap (pretty common size) is $13.50 at McMaster-Carr
Let's find the casters we want to if we need to buy a new tap, so be it.

Looks like the top two categories are Standard Duty and Heavy Duty. The difference seems to be in thickness of the frame material, and in price. For instance, comparing two casters (5" wheel diameter, 1/2"-13 thread, cushioned gray rubber tread on polypropylene wheels): standard duty is $16.68 ea (<http://www.mcmaster.com/#2460t53/=w1gzvj>), where heavy duty would be $26.15 (<http://www.mcmaster.com/#2437t78/=w1h15i>). Good bearings on both models, and it seems the "heavy-duty" has a lower max load capacity, but the "heavy duty" label probably refers to its lifecycle anyway.
heavy duty also comes with a debris cap to keep contaminants out of the swivel bearing.
we also have a choice to make between normal swivel caster and swivel caster with total lock (that's wheel lock + swivel lock in one switch)
or do we want each table to have 2 locking and 2 normal casters?
I usually do two locking and two swivel
if the floor is really uneven you can get into a situation where one of your locking casters isn't making contact with ground and you'll pivot about other locking caster
but I think our floor is pretty level
